appdriver

Class WordTracker

  • java.lang.Object
    • appdriver.WordTracker

  • public class WordTracker
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes in user input for file to be analysed and stored in tree It also takes type of report to be generated and also the filename(optional) where the results will be stored
    Version:
    12/09/2020
    Author:
    Armaan Singh Klair

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static BSTReferenceBased<Word> wordTree
      The tree where Word(s) will be stored

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WordTracker() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private static void loadExistingTree(java.lang.String filename)
      This method loads existing tree from 'repository.ser' if it exists
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      Main method takes in file containing data, report type, name of file where report goes(optional) It then loads from 'repository.ser' if it exists, then creates a tree from current file and stores the updated tree
      private static void report(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String reportType, boolean doReport)
      This method reports(prints to console/file) depending upon user choice
      private static void updateFrequencies(int totLines, java.lang.String datafile)
      Updates the frequencies of words of current file in the tree
      private static void writeUpdatedTree(java.lang.String filename)
      This method writes the updated tree to specified file

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main method takes in file containing data, report type, name of file where report goes(optional) It then loads from 'repository.ser' if it exists, then creates a tree from current file and stores the updated tree
        Parameters:
        args - Arguements to program i.e. the report type and filename of report output(optional)

      • loadExistingTree

        private static void loadExistingTree(java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method loads existing tree from 'repository.ser' if it exists
        Parameters:
        filename - File containing the stored binary tree
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when File not found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when stored object's class doesn't match definition of class it's being cast to

      • writeUpdatedTree

        private static void writeUpdatedTree(java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method writes the updated tree to specified file
        Parameters:
        filename - Filename to write tree to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown when File not found
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown when stored object's class doesn't match definition of class it's being cast to

      • updateFrequencies

        private static void updateFrequencies(int totLines,
                                      java.lang.String datafile)
        Updates the frequencies of words of current file in the tree
        Parameters:
        totLines - Total number of lines in current file
        datafile - The file containing the data that's being analyzed

      • report

        private static void report(java.lang.String filename,
                           java.lang.String reportType,
                           boolean doReport)
        This method reports(prints to console/file) depending upon user choice
        Parameters:
        filename - File to print report output to
        reportType - The type of report
        doReport - Indicates whether user wants to print report to a file or console
